intro: Roupala nonscripta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved roupala, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern around the stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subalpine regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
